PublishedCohortLibraryGetAll.clinicalAtRiskGroupsText:
The links below provide detailed information on the clinical rules that determine who is eligible for the booster.

The rules apply to:
- children aged 5 to 15 years within specific clinical at-risk groups
- adults ages 16 years and over

The clinical at-risk groups are:
PublishedCohortLibraryGetAll.demographicsText: All those aged 5 years or older in the clinical risk groups shown in Tables 3 and 4 of the Green Book.
PublishedCohortLibraryGetAll.description: The autumn booster is being offered to those at high risk of the complications of infection. The booster should help to reduce their risk of being admitted to hospital.
PublishedCohortLibraryGetAll.disclaimerText: The information provided outlines CaaS's approach to delivering this cohort using established methodologies. It highlights any differences from the clinical criteria in the Green Book and associated assumptions.
PublishedCohortLibraryGetAll.name: Autumn booster vaccinations
PublishedCohortLibraryGetAll.summary:
NHS England commissioned Cohort as a Service (CaaS) to identify people that were eligible for the autumn booster vaccination.
To be eligible, they needed to be:
- children aged 5 to 15 years
- adults aged 16 years and over
- in defined clinical risk groups shown in tables 3 and 4 of the [Green Book]( https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/)
CaaS developed specific rules based on the conditions in the Green Book and used clinical data to identify people who met the rules.
The data collected helped to:
- contact or remind people to receive their  autumn booster
- focus protection on those at clinical risk
- report and monitor on the autumn booster campaign

PublishedCohortLibraryGetAll.clinicalAtRiskGroupsText:
The condition groups listed below provide detailed information on who is included and excluded from the digital cohort.

The list is not exhaustive, and decisions should be based on clinical judgement.

The clinical at-risk groups are:
PublishedCohortLibraryGetAll.commissioner: NHS-E vaccination programme's Tech and Data workstream, delivered by NHS Digital.
PublishedCohortLibraryGetAll.demographicsText: All people aged 6 months or older that are in the clinical risk groups shown in the Green Book.
PublishedCohortLibraryGetAll.description: The vaccination is recommended for all people over 6 months of age. It provides protection to those who are at higher risk of serious illness.
PublishedCohortLibraryGetAll.disclaimerText: The information provided outlines CaaS's approach to delivering this cohort using established methodologies. It highlights any differences from the clinical criteria in the Green Book and associated assumptions.
PublishedCohortLibraryGetAll.name: Vaccinations 2022 to 2023
PublishedCohortLibraryGetAll.summary:
NHS England commissioned Cohorting as a Service (CaaS) to identify people that were eligible for the 2022 to 2023 vaccination.
To be eligible, they needed to be:
- 6 months of age or older
- in defined clinical risk groups shown in the [Green Book](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/)
CaaS developed specific rules based on the conditions in the Green Book and used clinical data to identify people who met those rules.
The data collected helped to:
- contact or remind people to receive their vaccination between 1 September 2022 and 31 March 2023
- focus protection on those at a clinical risk
- monitor the number of people who received the vaccination
